screw up.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to make a bad mistake or do something very stupid

screw up.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to spoil something by doing something stupid
screw up.translation[0].definitions[1].e: She realized that she had screwed up her life.
screw up.translation[0].definitions[2].d: to move the muscles in your face in a way that makes your eyes seem narrow
screw up.translation[0].definitions[2].e: He screwed up his eyes against the bright light.
Her face was screwed up with pain.
screw up.translation[0].definitions[3].d: to make someone feel very unhappy, confused, or upset so that they have emotional problems for a long time
screw up.translation[0].definitions[3].e: It really screwed her up when her mother died.
screw up.translation[0].definitions[4].d: to be brave enough to do something you are very nervous about
screw up.translation[0].definitions[4].e: I finally screwed up enough courage to talk to her.
